meanings.definition: To appoint or elect into a group or organization
meanings.sent1: The club members decided to coopt new members to join their team.
meanings.sent2: She successfully coopted her friend to join the school council.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried coopting the dog into its nap time plan.
meanings.sent4: The sun coopted the sky with its radiant light.
meanings.sent5: The teacher coopted the students' attention with an exciting experiment.

meanings.definition: To win over or persuade someone to join a cause or group
meanings.sent1: The charity organization is coopting volunteers to help with the event.
meanings.sent2: He coopted his classmates to participate in the environmental cleanup.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried coopting the audience into believing his tricks were real.
meanings.sent4: Her smile coopted everyone's hearts at the charity fundraiser.
meanings.sent5: The coach coopted the team's determination to win the championship.

meanings.definition: To take over or appropriate something for one's own use
meanings.sent1: The company was accused of coopting ideas from smaller businesses.
meanings.sent2: The artist coopted a famous painting to create a new masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried coopting the bird feeder for its acorn stash.
meanings.sent4: The storm coopted the peaceful day with its thunderous arrival.
meanings.sent5: The chef coopted traditional recipes to add a modern twist to the menu.
